title: Late Morning
commentary: Equities stabilize after early selling, but bulls remain sidelined: S&P pares losses to -0.3% at 49,550, Nasdaq -0.5% with semis dragging. Bitcoin treads water at $67,390 (flat 24h) as momentum stalls—price action coiling for next move. Ethereum slips to $2,033 (+1.0%). Gold extends gains to $5,242 (+0.5%), outperforming as real yields dip. Oil finds a floor at $66.20 (-1.2%). Weekly jobless claims at 215K came in below forecast—labor market remains tight.

title: Mid-Morning
commentary: Selling pressure builds as risk-off tone grips markets: S&P -0.5% slipping below 49,500, Nasdaq -0.7% with megacap tech under pressure. Bitcoin drifts to $67,640 (+1.4% 24h) as yesterday's rally fades; ETH follows at $2,049 (+3.0%). Gold catches a bid at $5,235 (+0.4%), silver $89.20 (+0.3%)—haven flows picking up. Oil extends decline to $66.10 (-1.4%) on China demand fears. Q4 GDP revision due tomorrow—traders positioning defensively ahead of data.

title: Market Open
commentary: Futures point lower as yesterday's crypto euphoria cools: S&P futures -0.3%, Nasdaq -0.4% with tech taking profits. Bitcoin retreats to $67,930 from $69K highs but holds +2.4% on 24h—pullback looks healthy after 7%+ surge. Ethereum steady at $2,065 (+5.1%). Gold ticks up to $5,225 (+0.2%) as safe-haven bids return; oil slides to $66.40 (-0.9%) on demand concerns. Durable goods data at 8:30 beat expectations—markets digesting. Watch for momentum shift at the open.

title: Market Close
commentary: Wall Street closes mixed as crypto steals the spotlight: S&P ekes out +0.4% to 49,680, Dow flat at 49,510, Nasdaq leads +0.9% on tech strength. Bitcoin extends rally to $69,200 (+7.4%), Ethereum pops 11.8% to $2,078—biggest daily gains in weeks fuel speculation of renewed institutional appetite. Gold settles at $5,218 (-0.1%), silver $88.90 (-0.2%) as risk assets dominate flows. Dollar index dips 0.3% to 106.20. Crypto futures open interest surging—bulls testing conviction.

title: Final Hour
commentary: Crypto stages stunning reversal: Bitcoin surges 7.2% to $69,060 as shorts squeeze and ETF inflows accelerate—Ethereum outpaces with 11.8% pop above $2,070. Equities hold gains into the close; Dow +0.6% at 49,480, S&P steady near 49,750. Gold consolidates at $5,220 (+0.4%), silver clings to $89 handle. Oil firm at $67 as API data looms. Risk-on vibes return to digital assets—is this the bottom or a bull trap?

title: Late Afternoon
commentary: Rally broadens into final hours: S&P climbs 0.6% to 49,720 with breadth improving—advancers lead decliners 3:1 on NYSE. Oil holds post-EIA gains (+1.0%) at $67.00 as traders bet on tightening supply. Gold steady (+0.5%) at $5,222, silver extends run (+1.2%) to $89.10 on copper sympathy bid. Bitcoin finds tentative floor at $62,000 (-3.8%) but volumes remain elevated—no clear capitulation yet. Fed's Waller speaks at 3pm, markets on watch for rate guidance.

title: Afternoon Session
commentary: Oil spikes on bullish EIA data: crude jumps 1.2% to $67.10 after surprise 4.2M barrel draw vs +1.5M expected—demand narrative back in play. Equities hold steady with S&P +0.4% at 49,650 as energy sector lifts. Precious metals firm: gold +0.6% at $5,228, silver +0.9% at $88.80. Crypto capitulation continues—Bitcoin plunges to $62,150 (-3.6%) as $180M in longs liquidated in past hour. Dollar flat at 97.70 as oil strength offsets risk-on flows.

title: Lunchtime
commentary: Markets hold gains into lunch: S&P up 0.5% at 49,675 as tech leads with Nvidia +2.3% on AI chip demand. Gold consolidates near highs (+0.7%) at $5,235, silver outperforms (+1.0%) at $88.95 as industrial metals catch bid. Crypto bloodbath deepens—Bitcoin crashes through $63K support to $62,800 (-2.6%), ETH down 2.2% as leveraged longs get liquidated. EIA crude data due in an hour; oil steady +0.2% at $66.28. Dollar index slips 0.2% to 97.65 on rate-cut repricing.

title: Midday Session
commentary: Rally extends into midday: Dow jumps 0.5% to 49,623 as rate-cut hopes resurface after soft housing data. Gold surges to session highs (+0.8%) at $5,240, silver follows (+0.7%) to $88.75 as real yields dip. Crypto remains the laggard—Bitcoin drops to $63,520 (-1.5%) with large exchange inflows signaling more selling pressure ahead. Oil trims gains to +0.3% at $66.35 as dollar steadies. Markets now pricing 60% chance of May Fed cut, up from 45% yesterday.

title: Morning Session
commentary: Early buyers emerge: S&P climbs 0.3% to 49,560 as economic data shows resilient consumer spending despite tariff headwinds. Gold pushes higher (+0.5%) to $5,224 reclaiming ground after Tuesday's profit-taking—haven bid persists. Bitcoin slides further to $63,850 (-1.0%) as Grayscale outflows accelerate; ETH follows at -0.8%. Silver gains traction (+0.4%) to $88.55 on industrial demand narrative. Oil holds +0.5% at $66.50 as traders eye EIA inventory data due this afternoon.
